title: Waiting for Paint to Dry
description: Since running out on her sister's wedding (and knocking a bridesmaid over in the process) Matty Bell has lived 'safe' in her self-made monochromatic life of work-eat-sleep-survive. Living vicariously through her best friend perfect life wasn't the plan. However, Matty learned long ago that it's easier to run and hide from life than to deal with triggers from the past.When life finally catches up with Matty on the night of her 30th Birthday, a nerve-wreaking last-minute trip home to confront her family might just result in her coming full-healing-circle. However, showing up unannounced has Matty staying in her sister's ocean front home alone, with thoughts of the married man she sat next to on the plane ride out to California clouding her resolve. And then there's that pile of left over paint daring her to take redemption into her own hands.From the author of "Hard-Hitting Fiction, with a Dose of Healing-Humor" comes a serious yet laughter-filled healing story of one's woman journey to reclaim her life, find inner-peace, and stumble into love...
author: Lia Mack
